titles.title: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit consideration of any measure proposing a balanced-budget constitutional amendment until the Congressional Budget Office certifies that the Federal budget has been in balance for the two most recently completed fiscal years.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H1257)

bill.summary: 3/10/1994--Introduced. Amends rule XXII of the Rules of the House of Representatives to make it out of order to consider any measure proposing a constitutional amendment to balance the Federal budget until the Director of the Congressional Budget Office certifies to the House that the Federal budget has been in balance for the two most recently completed fiscal years.
